results.title: See how they grow
results.creator_credit: Tom Gordon, Dorling Kindersley Vision and Video School
results.brief_description: A delightful and entertaining natural history series for young children with superb live action photography charting the growth of animals. We watch the animals growing and share their adventures as they learn about their new world.

results.title: See Britain
results.brief_description: A travelogue of famous beauty spots and places of interest in England. The camera visits London, Salisbury and the university town of Cambridge, travels through Lincolnshire, then goes to the rocky coast of Devon and Cornwall which charm the visitor with their unique beauty.

results.title: See better: healthy eyes
results.brief_description: Classroom film answering questions on eye care. Explains the general structure of the eyes, important health and safety practices relating to eye care, and common ways to treat disorders of vision.

results.title: See 'n tell: the lizard
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and life cycle of the common ground lizard as it feeds on insects and spiders, sheds its skin and mates in early summer. Also shows egg-laying by the female and the hatching of baby lizards. No narration.

results.title: See
results.brief_description:
Off the coast of Sudan, many brilliantly hued creatures live on the coral reefs. Robin Lehman has filmed these creatures - from the translucent to the psychedelic - as they parade in front of the camera.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Seduction: the cruel woman
results.brief_description: This video is based on two classic s/m novels; “Venus in Furs”, and “The Story of O”. “Venus in Furs” portrays the insatiable desire of one man to submit to one very cruel woman - indeed his love-ridden slavishness is so demanding that it takes a considerable toll on her. This is one sub-plot of this video. Wanda is the cruel woman, and through the course of the video, all Wanda’s primary relationships change, and yet the show, the performance art of sado-masochism, goes on. English subtitles.

results.title: Sedimentry rocks
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Illustrates the importance of sedimentary rocks in understanding earth’s history. Sediment is the result of chemical and mechanical weathering assisted by erosion, water, ice and biological activities such as movement of dunes. Sedimentary rocks hold much of the fossil evidence which provide insight into the evolution of life on earth. The building up of sedimentary layers results in the formation of structures such as reefs and formations like limestone caves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television

results.title: Sedatives
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”

One of a series of drug films which explains the uses of sedatives and effects on the individual’s personality. Looks at tolerance and physical and psychological dependence.
